body_html:
I'm using ubuntu 16.04 LTS & GTX1080, with CUDA-8.0 and cuDNN-5.105 installed, I've downgrade gcc to gcc-5.3.0. I also have installed gcc-4.9 as backup choice.
link to stackoverflow question:
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/39095577/tensorflow-build-failure-with-gcc-error-as
the command I type:
sudo bazel build -c opt --config=cuda //tensorflow/tools/pip_package:build_pip_package
The first time I got this error.

However, It returns '/usr/bin/as' when I type 'which as' in command line. I'm tried symlinks which doesn't work. Me and my friend are guessing that it could be due to that we downgrade our complier and we still haven't figured out how to solve it.
btw, I've tried adding cxx_buildin_include_directory and add cxx_flag according to what previous issues says but the problem was not fixed.

And I tried cloning the the master branch and building. Still haven't figured out what happened here.

I'm having a third kind of error message now and I will paste it later...

PS: my configure script

Please specify the location of python. [Default is /usr/bin/python]:
Do you wish to build TensorFlow with Google Cloud Platform support? [y/N] n
No Google Cloud Platform support will be enabled for TensorFlow
Do you wish to build TensorFlow with GPU support? [y/N] y
GPU support will be enabled for TensorFlow
Please specify which gcc nvcc should use as the host compiler. [Default is /usr/bin/gcc]:
Please specify the Cuda SDK version you want to use, e.g. 7.0. [Leave empty to use system default]: 8.0
Please specify the location where CUDA 8.0 toolkit is installed. Refer to README.md for more details. [Default is /usr/local/cuda]:
Please specify the Cudnn version you want to use. [Leave empty to use system default]: 5 
Please specify the location where cuDNN 5 library is installed. Refer to README.md for more details. [Default is /usr/local/cuda]:
Please specify a list of comma-separated Cuda compute capabilities you want to build with.
You can find the compute capability of your device at...
： 6.1

@akors

body:
I'm using ubuntu 16.04 LTS & GTX1080, with CUDA-8.0 and cuDNN-5.105 installed, I've downgrade gcc to gcc-5.3.0. I also have installed gcc-4.9 as backup choice.
link to stackoverflow question:
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/39095577/tensorflow-build-failure-with-gcc-error-as
the command I type:
sudo bazel build -c opt --config=cuda //tensorflow/tools/pip_package:build_pip_package
The first time I got this error.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/19640630/17969359/4b950658-6b04-11e6-8845-66510656fbec.png)
However,  It returns '/usr/bin/as' when I type 'which as' in command line. I'm tried symlinks which doesn't work. Me and my friend are guessing that it could be due to that we downgrade our complier and we still haven't figured out how to solve it.
btw, I've tried adding cxx_buildin_include_directory and add cxx_flag according to what previous issues says but the problem was not fixed.

And I tried cloning the the master branch and building. Still haven't figured out what happened here.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/19640630/17969570/507a9c9a-6b05-11e6-9ed4-a26f8f2451ee.png)
I'm having a third  kind of error message now and I will paste it later...

PS: my configure script

```
Please specify the location of python. [Default is /usr/bin/python]:
Do you wish to build TensorFlow with Google Cloud Platform support? [y/N] n
No Google Cloud Platform support will be enabled for TensorFlow
Do you wish to build TensorFlow with GPU support? [y/N] y

Please specify which gcc nvcc should use as the host compiler. [Default is /usr/bin/gcc]:
Please specify the Cuda SDK version you want to use, e.g. 7.0. [Leave empty to use system default]: 8.0
Please specify the location where CUDA 8.0 toolkit is installed. Refer to README.md for more details. [Default is /usr/local/cuda]:
Please specify the Cudnn version you want to use. [Leave empty to use system default]: 5 
Please specify the location where cuDNN 5 library is installed. Refer to README.md for more details. [Default is /usr/local/cuda]:
Please specify a list of comma-separated Cuda compute capabilities you want to build with.
You can find the compute capability of your device at...
： 6.1
```

@akors
